verbs.description: unfurl (third-person singular simple present unfurls, present participle unfurling, simple past and past participle unfurled)

entries.meaning: To unroll or release something that had been rolled up, typically a sail or a flag.
examples: They unfurled the flag at the start of the festival.

entries.meaning: (figurative) To roll out or debut anything.
examples: When will we be unfurling the new feature?

entries.meaning: (intransitive, figurative) To turn out or unfold; to evolve; to progress.
